Text: Risk Memo Coal Supply Master Agreement with Edison Mission Cc Forwarded by Robert QuickLONECT on PM Nina Edmonds PM To Robert CT cc Subject Risk Memo Coal Supply Master Agreement with Edison Mission Forwarded by Nina EdmondsLONECT on Nina Edmonds To Mark E HaedickeHOUECT Julia MurrayHOUECT cc Mark FrevertLONECT Danny McCartyLONECT John SherriffLONECT Rick BuyHOUECT Steve W YoungLONECT Scott SeftonLONECT Michael R BrownLONECT George McClellanHOUECT Stuart StaleyLONECT Alan B AronowitzHOUECT bcc Subject Risk Memo Coal Supply Master Agreement with Edison Mission This risk memo relates to the sale by Enron Capital Trade Resources Ltd ECTRL of coal to a subsidiary of Edison Mission Edison First Power Limited EFPL EFPL is in the process of acquiring from Powergen two power plants Fiddlers Ferry and Ferrybridge which are coal fired The anticipated financial closing of the acquisition is th July The sales to EFPL will be done under the basis of a master agreement the Master subject to English law and LCIA arbitration This is based on our international coal sale and purchase master agreement but has been the subject of significant negotiations between EFPL and Enron There is no obligation on either party to complete any actual transactions but it is anticipated that all of EFPLs shortterm coal requirements will be met by ECTRL under the Master The arrangement reflected in the Master and the confirmations give rise to the following legal risks General EFPL appears to be in the process of acquiring the power stations without thinking through the commercial and logistical constraints on the supply of coal to the plants In effect EFPL is seeking to hedge with Enron their fuel supply by requiring Enron to deliver coal to the power plants EFPLs situation has been made worse by virtue of the fact that they have negotiated a very unfavourable agreement with Powergen which owns a terminal for bulk delivery of coal into the port of Liverpool LBT Fortunately there are separate confirmations for LBT deliveries and the commercial people are aware that any LBT deliveries are fraught with legal logistical and commercial risks Compliance with all Laws EFPL has tried to insist that ECTRL represents that it shall comply with all applicable laws regulations orders etc in any relevant jurisdictions Bearing in mind that we could be sourcing coal from a number of different jurisdictions such as Indonesia Australia South Africa Poland etc this would clearly be a significantly onerous provision especially as should we be in breach of this representation could trigger an event of default under the Master The position at the moment is that we have proposed that this be diluted by our agreeing to use reasonable endeavours to comply and our fall back position is that we would agree to use best endeavours subject to a proviso that we not be required to commit undue expenditure to so comply the basic difference between reasonable and best endeavours under English law is a question of how much cash is spent Sampling The question of sampling and quality control is crucial in respect of EFPLs rejection rights under the Master EFPL to date has insisted that samplingquality control be determined effectively at the power plants ECTRL has countered with samplingquality control being determined at the port of loading so that we are back to back with our purchase agreement and if EFPL rejects ECTRL can in turn reject and put the coal back onto the supplier If ECTRL agrees to EFPLs proposal then ECTRL will be taking significant basis risk in that coal could be rejected at a point inland in the UK which would leave ECTRL with possibly limited rights of recourse against its supplier and with significant quantities of coal which may have a low resale value at the delivery point in the UK Force Majeure In relation to LBT deliveries only specific socalled force majeure provisions would apply overriding the fm provisions in the Master which would in effect mean that ECTRL would have little if no force majeure protection at all This goes back to the point that LBT deliveries carry significant risks Energy Levy Negotiations are still continuing with regard to who should bear the risk of the climate change levy which is due to be imposed on coal in the near future The commercial leader of the transaction Stuart Staley has been full apprised of the above legal risks If you have any queries or comments please do not hesitate to contact me in London on extension Best regards Robert Quick

Re Utilicorp United ADM requesting ability to transact UK crude and oil productsthink so Assume they wish to transact UK financial crude and oil rather than physical tks From Tana Jones on CDT To Robert CT cc Subject Re Utilicorp United ADM requesting ability to transact UK crude and oil products Any problem Forwarded by Tana JonesHOUECT on PM Alan Aronowitz PM To Harry M CT cc Tana CT Robert CT Subject Re Utilicorp United ADM requesting ability to transact UK crude and oil products Tana Please check with Robert Quick on this Thanks Alan Harry M Collins PM To Tana CT cc Alan CT Subject Re Utilicorp United ADM requesting ability to transact UK crude and oil products I do not know of any reason that they should not be able to transact UK oil and products However it would be best to also check with London on this request Tana Jones AM To Alan CT Harry M CT cc Subject Re Utilicorp United ADM requesting ability to transact UK crude and oil products I dont see any problem with this request do you Forwarded by Tana JonesHOUECT on AM Stephanie Sever AM To Tana CT Karen CT cc Subject Re Utilicorp United ADM requesting ability to transact UK crude and oil products Please let me know if this request is OK Thanks Stephanie Forwarded by Stephanie SeverHOUECT on AM Brant Reves AM To Stephanie CT cc Subject Re Utilicorp United ADM requesting ability to transact UK crude and oil products We are ok with this request for Utilicorp United Inc brant From Stephanie Sever AM To Brant CT cc Subject Utilicorp United ADM requesting ability to transact UK crude and oil products Forwarded by Stephanie SeverHOUECT on AM From Mary Griff Gray AM To Tom CT Lisa CT Stephanie CT cc Subject Utilicorp United ADM requesting ability to transact UK crude and oil products Tom What do you think Thanks Griff x

Re Standard European Coal AgreementI sent the attached to you a couple of weeks ago we are going to launch SECA in the next few days so unless I here from you otherwise I shall run this past Sullivan Cromwell next week tks Robert Forwarded by Robert QuickLONECT on London Fax System To Robert CT cc Subject New fax received Likely sender You have received a new fax from The image contains pages

freight derivatives EOL Cc trawled through the list of jurisdictions of potential counterparties to the freight swapsoptions A list Norway Denmark Germany Switzerland UK Belgium France Netherlands Singapore Australia We have already done full EOL due diligence on the above jurisdictions The only issue which we wd just need to cover is whether for regulatory purposes freight is treated as a commodity We shd be able to get answers on that issue quickly B list Turkey Taiwan Japan Argentina Israel Gibraltar S Korea We do not have much on the above jurisdictions here although Mark T may have done some due diligence on the non European nonmiddle eastern countries Do you want us to undertake full due diligence on these C list Liberia Panama Cayman Isl BVI Bermuda Bahamas BWI I understand that decisions may have already been made not to include entities incorporated into these jurisdictions because of money laundering issues lack of corporate transparency etc Cd this be confirmed Many thanks Robert

FW Worldscale Pricinghere are some words on how it works tks Original Message From Duggan Caroline Sent May To Quick Robert Aziz Arfan Subject Re Worldscale Pricing FYI on worldscale pricing Forwarded by Caroline DugganLONECT on Scott Moncrieff To Anna CT cc Caroline CT Robert CT Subject Re Worldscale Pricing eg somebody buys the spread at worldscale for november they buy contracts mts each to emulate a voyage cross north sea the current market say is the spot market goes through the roof and the average for november ends up to be settlement is x mts x x minus mts x x settlement figure so the worldscale spot rate is a percentage of the flat rate for the voyage in question ie the spot market at the moment is worldscale which means the equivalent pmt rate is x Anna Gardiner To Scott CT cc Caroline CT Subject Worldscale Pricing Scott Could you let me know in writing you the full calculation for reaching your current dollar price that you are offering on EOL I understand that you are basing it from your flat rate price of I would also like to know if the worldscale rate is always a set percentage of the USD rate or does it ever fluctuate Thanks Anna

FW Altrade International Contract Cc Mark I wonder whether you will be able to help out on this Attached is a usage agreement with a company called Altrade Energy System Corp It is subject to Texas law wh I imagine is nonnegotiable Wd someone in yr group be able to look over this for Bo Bo heads up the NGL group here in Europe many tks Robert Original Message From Petersen Bo Sent October To Quick Robert Subject FW Altra International Contract As promised Original Message From Paula Rodriguez mailto Sent Tuesday October AM To Petersen Bo Subject Altra International Contract Hey Bo Here are copies of Altras international contract in Word Doc so your lawyers can make changes Either email back or FAX when complete Thanks Paula Solarc Agreement Letterdoc NGLCrudedoc Thanks yall Paula V Rodriguez Altra Energy Technologies Inc Lamar Suite Houston Texas email
